guicomponents

Class G4P

  • java.lang.Object
    • guicomponents.G4P
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GConstants, PConstants

    public class G4P
extends Object
implements PConstants, GConstants
    This class has only static methods. It keeps track of all GComponents created. Its primary role is encapsulated in the draw() method which can override the default Processing drawing mechanism.
    Author:
    Peter Lager

      INTERNAL USE ONLY
      This should be called by all ctors in GComponent and since all GUI components inherit from GComponent and are required to call a GComponent ctor then all GUI components will automatically be registered in the set.

      • getFamily

        public static String getFamily(String family)
        See if this font family is available on this user's computer system and return the family name if found. If the font family is unavailable then it returns the name "Dialog"
        Parameters:
        family -
        Returns:

      • setMouseOverEnabled

        public static void setMouseOverEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enables or disables cursor over component change.
        This method is ignore if an applet or window has not been registered with G4P or the mouse over state is not being changed. This is ignored if no G4P components have been created yet
        Parameters:
        enable -

      • addComponent

        public static void addComponent(PApplet app,
                GComponent c)
        INTERNAL USE ONLY
        This should be called by all ctors in GComponent and since all GUI components inherit from GComponent and are required to call a GComponent ctor then all GUI components will automatically be registered in the set.
        Parameters:
        theApplet -
        c - the component that has been created.

      • dumpComponent

        public static void dumpComponent(GComponent c)
        INTERNAL USE ONLY
        Remove a component so that it is permanently unavailable.
        Do not call this method directly otherwise your program will crash.
        Use the components dispose method instead.
        Parameters:
        c - the component to remove

      • addWindow

        public static guicomponents.G4P.AppletInfo addWindow(PApplet app)
        Add a PApplet object to G4P if not already there.
        The only time you might want to use this is when you are mixing G4P and OpenGL. In which case call this method from setup() immediately after the call to size() and before any statements that might alter the initial drawing matrix e.g. 
        void setup(){

          size(480, 320);

          G4P.addWindow(this);

        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet object to add

      • removeWindow

        Remove control window - called when a ControlWindow is closed for good.
        Parameters:

        Parameters:

      • setFont

        public static void setFont(String fontName,
           int fontSize)
        Set the global font to be used by all controls.
        You can override the font used by individual controls with the equivalent setFont method for the control.
        Parameters:
        fontName - font family name
        fontSize - font size

      • setFont

        public static void setFont(String fontName,
           int fontSize,
           int style)
        Set the global font to be used by all controls.
        You can override the font used by individual controls with the equivalent setFont method for the control.
        The style argument is an integer bitmask that may be PLAIN, or a bitwise union of BOLD and/or ITALIC (for example, ITALIC or BOLD|ITALIC). If the style is unrecognised it will default to PLAIN.
        Parameters:
        fontName - font family name
        fontSize - font size
        style - style e.g. Font.PLAIN

      • setFont

        public static void setFont(Font font)
        Set the global font to be used by all controls.
        You can override the font used by individual controls with the equivalent setFont method for the control.
        Parameters:
        font - the java.awt.Font to use

      • draw

        public static void draw(PApplet app)
        When you first use G4P(app) it switches off auto draw for the PApplet app.

      • isAutoDrawOn

        public static boolean isAutoDrawOn(PApplet app)

      • messagesEnabled

        public static void messagesEnabled(boolean enable)
        G4P has a range of support messages eg
        if you create a GUI component without an event handler or,
        a slider where the visible size of the slider is less than the difference between min and max values. This method allows the user to enable (default) or disable this option. If disable then it should be called before any GUI components are created.
        Parameters:
        enable -

      • setDrawOrder

        public static void setDrawOrder(GWindow window)
        This will sort the GUI controls in a secondary window.
        Parameters:
        window - the GWindow object

      • setDrawOrder

        public static void setDrawOrder(PApplet app)
        If you are using GPanel or GCombo it would be useful to call this method in setup or customGUI (if using GUI builder tool).
        DO NOT CALL this method from inside the draw() method.
        This will sort the draw order for GUI controls based on their z attribute - note that a control will be drawn before a control with a higher z. If two controls have the same z value, then the controls are ordered by their vertical screen position. This means that controls near the bottom of the display will be drawn before those nearer the top.
        Parameters:
        windowApp - the PApplet object

      • moveToFrontForDraw

        public static void moveToFrontForDraw(GComponent comp)
        INTERNAL USE ONLY
        Used to bring a panel to the front of the display.
        Do not use this method directly.

      • moveToFrontForMouse

        public static void moveToFrontForMouse(GComponent comp)
        INTERNAL USE ONLY
        Used to ensure the panel is the last component to be tested for mouse events.
        Do not use this method.
